messages.message:
I see an issue with dragging a file into a new Converse project on aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com (http://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com)
It opens up the file in a new tab instead of being added. Demonstrated in the recording

Able to reproduce this - we need to fix this ahead of 24.10 push, is a blocker bug.
cc: @Subash can you triage and help fix ?

Jessica has merged some changes (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/54672) in UAT last night, which is causing this issue. @Jessica do we need this backport, since react 17 is still not in UAT and the issue that PR fixes was not in UAT, but only in sandbox

No the react 17 change made it in before UAT code cut. Maybe I just messed up that PR and checked before merging that the drag events were working but not the drop events. I can take a look in the morning but @Subash it might be as easy as taking out some e.stopPropagations?
Actually I bet we need to remove the capture: true from the drop event
Let me try it out. I can raise a PR if it works
Btw I see the same problem in aihub-sandbox.internal
I checked the package.json from UAT. It still refers to react 16 - https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/release-24.10.0-aihub/webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/package.json

Also, React upgrade code was merged to master on Mar 8 while 24.10 branch was cut on Mar 6.
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C04TSMWLPAS/p1709673291368929

I will raise a revert PR for the changes that went into UAT last night. I tested this locally, it fixes the issue in UAT.
This still needs a proper fix on sandbox. Revert PR for UAT: https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/54722

Possible fix for the issue - https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/54723/files

@Jessica would like to know your thoughts this approach. I have tested in converse app and build app locally and it works, not sure if there are any more corner cases we have to handle.

Ah I think I got confused about code cut date because of the last late GA date :facepalm: thanks for reverting that.

@Subash I want to try to find a way of doing this using the document event handlers since that's what react 17 expressly fixes - I'm having trouble right now because crafting is working for me but I will get that figured out this morning
Merged revert backport - should be good for UAT/24.10
